title: Strictly's Catherine Tyldesley steps out with Johannes Radebe one day after their shock elimination
text:
She was booted off Strictly Come Dancing on Sunday in a shock elimination.

And Catherine Tyldesley put on a brave face as she arrived at the It Takes Two studios with her former dance partner Johannes Radebe on Monday.

The former Corrie actress, 37, looked chic in a scarlet printed dress which cinched in at her trim waist and flowed into an ankle length skirt.

Brave face: Catherine Tyldesley put on a brave face as she arrived at the It Takes Two studios with her former dance partner Johannes Radebe on Monday

The star paired this with black stiletto sandals and wrapped up in a black leather jacket.

Her brunette locks were styled in soft waves while fluttery lashes and nude lipstick enhanced her pretty features.

Johannes, 32, looked smart in a black and gold patterned jacket paired with joggers and trainers as he smiled for the cameras.

The pair's sighting comes after Catherine made a thinly-veiled dig at the Strictly Come Dancing judges after being eliminated from the competition on Sunday night.

Positive: Johannes, 32, looked smart in a black and gold patterned jacket paired with joggers and trainers as he smiled for the cameras

The actress liked a tweet saying she was 'the better dancer by far' after finding herself in the bottom two with Mike Bushell and his partner Katya Jones.

Catherine's exit caused shock-waves among viewers at home with many branding the show a fix and claiming Mike 'avoided the chop because he works for the BBC'.

Seemingly giving her take on the situation, Catherine liked a tweet which read: 'Sorry but @Cath_Tyledesley did not deserve to go tonight in @bbcstrictly... she was the better dance by far..

'Hold your head up high my darling Cath... you've been a joy to watch from start to finish. Big love to you and @jojo_radebe.'

Hours earlier, head judge Shirley Ballas defended her decision to eliminate Catherine on Twitter as she hit back at the trolls and liked tweets about how angry viewers should 'grow up'.

Chic: The former Corrie actress, 37, looked chic in a scarlet printed dress which cinched in at her trim waist and flowed into an ankle length skirt

Catherine and Johannes failed to impress the judges when they performed their Cha Cha once again at the end of the show's Halloween Week, after scraping the bottom of the leaderboard with a score of 24 out of a possible 40.

After the axing, Mike defiantly appeared on BBC Breakfast to defend himself, already at rehearsals for his next dance.

He said: 'It's an entertainment show, we're all trying our best, you're not really competing against anybody else, you compete against yourself to try and learn to get better and better each week, even if its just learning a couple of new steps.

Glossy: Her brunette locks were styled in soft waves while fluttery lashes and nude lipstick enhanced her pretty features

Chic: Saffron Barker looked chic as she headed to the studios in her workout gear

Couple: Chris Ramsey and wife Rosie looked smitten as they left the studios

Casual: Chris' dance partner Karen Clifton cut a casual figure as she arrived

Bottom of the leaderboard: Catherine and Johannes failed to impress the judges when they performed their Cha Cha once again at the end of the show's Halloween Week,

'As a non-dancer all I can do is put the hours in, do my best and get through it. You have to rise above the abuse on social media, that's one of the sad things about social media.

'All you can do is do your best, accept the judges' decision and move on. Johannes and Catherine are lovely people, I didn't want to see them go but someone has to go.

'It's like football - you have to accept the referee's decision. [The judges] are the best judges in the world, they do know what they're talking about, if they'd sent me home that would have been the best decision, I can't get involved in any of that.'
description: Catherine Tyldesley put on a brave face as she arrived at the It Takes Two studios with her former dance partner Johannes Radebe on Monday.
